location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. Circled serial numbers (red for received correspondence; blue/black for issued correspondence) refer to entries in the notes at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation system in use commences at 1 on the front cover, and continues through to 209 on the back cover. The sequence is written in pencil and appears in the top right hand corner of the recto page of each folio. About half the numbers have been underlined. Foliation anomalies: ff. 1, 1A; ff. 28, 28A; ff. 121, 121A, 121B, 121C, 121D, 121E, 121F, 121G, 121H, 121I, 121J, 121K, 121L. The following numbers do not appear in the sequence: 178-179.

mods.abstract: The file includes a copy of a memorandum from the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf to the Foreign Secretary to the Government of India, Simla, dated 19 September 1931, concerning the proposed amalgamation of the Khorasan and Sistan Consulate Establishments with the Persian Gulf cadre, and the consequent submission of a list of the combined clerical cadre, with covering circular letter to the Political Agent Bahrein [Bahrain], dated 27 September 1931; nominal rolls of the Persian Gulf, Meshed and Sistan Clerical Establishment, 1931-1933 inclusive; nominal rolls of the Persian Gulf, Meshed, and Zabul Clerical Establishment, 1936-1946 inclusive; correspondence concerning appointments, postings, and transfers of individual Clerks; correspondence concerning pensionable service; correspondence concerning promotions and confirmations; correspondence concerning officiating arrangements; circular memorandum from the British Consulate-General, Bushire requesting information on the members of the clerical cadre at Bahrain, and reply from the Political Agency, Bahrain giving relevant details, June 1942; and a letter from a Clerk concerning his entry in the nominal roll, February 1943.The covering dates of the correspondence (the main body of papers) in the file are 27 September 1931 to 12 May 1946. The closing date in the overall date range is supplied by an entry in the notes at the rear of the file.
